performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: GD and ABB? Always. Bewildered no one submitted this yet.
15.5 minutes after Alligator begins, or at the 5:00 mark of the 2nd "Alligator" there is a mountain.
Check out "Primal Alligator Jam" on Feb. 07, 1969 and tell me this isn't a Mountain Jam.  Anyone?  In any case, I'm blown away by it.
Jerry drops in some mountain jam during a sizzling hot NFA->GDTRFB medley
It's just one "First there is a mountain, then there is a mountain and then there is" in the CCS>IKYR transition.
MJ weaves in and out of this extended riffin along with AWBYG echoes, Lovelight stains and I dunno what else
"Mountain Jam tuning" to open the show
Jerry with the Allman Brothers, May The Circle Be Unbroken > Mountain Jam. Glorious

performances.venue: Grand Prix Racecourse Watkins Glen, NY
performances.description: Not sure what constitutes a "Mountain Jam" but this is a jam in the mountain and it's fantastic stuff. Garcia soars w/ that '73 tone, Lesh is on fire.
During Alligator, post-drums. One of the most discernible, helps that show was recorded on multi-track.
Maybe the earliest, it’s quoted for a few rounds and is notable in how Jerry weaves it into the charging Alligator Jam
